senses.definition: ' If you say someone is a certain number of years old, you mean that they have lived for that length of time.

note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is young.   2' 'adjective If something is old, it has existed for a long time.    We explored the old part of the city. Our old boss made us work much harder.  I preferred your old hairstyle.

senses.definition: ' owing to'  If something happens owing to something else, the second thing is the cause of the first.
example: I must pay the butcher the two dollars I owe him
I owe you an apology for being so rude earlier
I owe my life to the skill of the surgeon. [j33] Vera owes her blue eyes to her mother and her dark hair to her father
My flight was cancelled owing to fog. [j33] Owing to her poor eyesight, she was rejected as a police recruit
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective owing' The amount owing is $2.00.
